instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: iMac 21.5" Mid Late 2015 820-00430-A no clue
threads.message:
[LEFT][COLOR=#000000][FONT=verdana]820-00430-A first LED light comes on, I have never worked on an iMac board so I dont even know how to power this thing with a power supply, boardview and schematics are nowhere to be found.

Board is clean no visible damage anywhere, board 3v battery was replaced but still no startup.

Any guidance will be greatly appreciated.[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]

threads.title: iMac 21.5" Mid Late 2015 820-00430-A no clue
threads.message:
Maybe 820-4668 schematic helps you a bit.
Taking this as guide, only need to connect 12V at pins 4-6/J6900.
If first LED (LE0301) stays on, board is in S5 state.

If CMOS coin cell is removed, board should start by itself.
Check if you get pulse at any S3/S0 power rail (big coils).
I recommend you to change Q8450.

threads.title: iMac 21.5" Mid Late 2015 820-00430-A no clue
threads.message: Thanks, battery removed board not starting, no pulsing on big coils, replaced Q8450 still nothing, U6200 was getting really hot removed it for now as I think the iMac should start even without that one, but nada!

threads.title: iMac 21.5" Mid Late 2015 820-00430-A no clue
threads.message:
If U6200 is same audio power, like in schematic, board can start without it.
It also means that board achieves S4 state, if that chip heats; is on 5V_S4 rail.
Can you confirm presence of such voltage on its coil?
PM_SLP_S5_L should be high.

threads.title: iMac 21.5" Mid Late 2015 820-00430-A no clue
threads.message: Yes U6200 is audio related, after removing U6200 5V_S4 present on its coil, in fact I am making it to PP1V2_S3 checking Q4020 now but I seem to be stock.

threads.title: iMac 21.5" Mid Late 2015 820-00430-A no clue
threads.message:
I think Im close to finding the problem,

U8450
1. 12v
2.3.2v
3. 0v
4. 0v
5.12v
6. 12v
7. 23v
8. 3.3v

U6970
[LEFT][COLOR=#000000][FONT=Arial]1. 12v[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]
[LEFT][COLOR=#000000][FONT=Arial]2.3.4v[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]
[LEFT][COLOR=#000000][FONT=Arial]3. 0v[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]
[LEFT][COLOR=#000000][FONT=Arial]4. 0v[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]
[LEFT][COLOR=#000000][FONT=Arial]5.12v[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]
[LEFT][COLOR=#000000][FONT=Arial]6. 12v[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]
[LEFT][COLOR=#000000][FONT=Arial]7. 22v[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]
[LEFT][COLOR=#000000][FONT=Arial]8. 3.8v

I don't have any boards that have those chips so I cannot replace them yet, I will order them once I know that is the problem, thanks for all the tips so far, if I fix this one this will be my first iMac fixed.[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]

threads.title: iMac 21.5" Mid Late 2015 820-00430-A no clue
threads.message:
U8450 looks good.
It doesn't fail, just Q8450.
Which is also good if you get 12V_S0.
And of course U/Q6970 both good, as you already got S5 state.
When corresponding MOSFET is bad, you will not get 22V output from U6970/8450.

Check if PM_SLP_S4_L pulses at least.
Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for reaction at PM_PWRBTN_L.

threads.title: iMac 21.5" Mid Late 2015 820-00430-A no clue
threads.message:
The 23v made me think something was wrong since the schematics show 12v on that line.

[LEFT][COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]PM_SLP_S4_L [/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT] is 3.3v steady I dont know how to trigger [LEFT][COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]SMC_ONOFF_L but it is 3.4v steady also PM_PWRBTN_L. is 3.4v steady[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]

threads.title: iMac 21.5" Mid Late 2015 820-00430-A no clue
threads.message:
If PM_SLP_S4_L is steady high, you should get all S3 voltages; check that.
You should see a drop pulse on PM_PWRBTN_L when triggering SMC_ONOFF_L.

"I dont know how to trigger"
Imagine something like pressing power button; J5120 can be used...

threads.title: iMac 21.5" Mid Late 2015 820-00430-A no clue
threads.message: I do [LEFT][COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]see a drop pulse on PM_PWRBTN_L when triggering SMC_ONOFF_L or when "pressing power button"[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]

threads.title: iMac 21.5" Mid Late 2015 820-00430-A no clue
threads.message:
Then all PM_SLP_Sx_L signals must pulse.
And of course, corresponding voltages should pulse too.

threads.title: iMac 21.5" Mid Late 2015 820-00430-A no clue
threads.message: None of [LEFT][COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]PM_SLP_Sx_L pulse, the voltage is there but no pulse either with a trigger on SMC_ONOFF_L or a power button press.[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]

threads.title: iMac 21.5" Mid Late 2015 820-00430-A no clue
threads.message: Ok Im now at PP0V6_S3_DDRVTT that power line is not present in U7300 pin 3 but present on XW7325 but with 1.2v and not 0.6v as the schecmatic shows, Im hoping this will be the culprit...

threads.title: iMac 21.5" Mid Late 2015 820-00430-A no clue
threads.message:
"None of[COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit] PM_SLP_Sx_L pulse, the voltage is there but no pulse[/FONT][/COLOR]"
That is good, if you have stable levels.
I said to check for pulse, in case no stable high level...

PP0V6_S3_DDRVTT comes from pin 3/U7300.
Maybe you didn't have good contact when measured.

Looks like you have all voltages on the board.
Confirm that for CPU coils.
Check for USB activity with mouse/keyboard.

threads.title: iMac 21.5" Mid Late 2015 820-00430-A no clue
threads.message:
[LEFT][COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]PP0V6_S3_DDRVTT not present on pin 3 of U7300 tripple checked it, even gave it a re-solder and nothing, whats also strange is that pin 5 is 0.6v rather than 1.2v as mentioned in the schematics.[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]

REG_PHASE_P1V05S0_L is 0v on its coil same with REG_PHASE_CPUVCC_1 and REG_PHASE_CPUVCC_2

threads.title: iMac 21.5" Mid Late 2015 820-00430-A no clue
threads.message:
So no CPU VCORE, board cannot work.
Check for enable signals at pins 16/17 of U7300.
Also check if receives 5V at pin 12.

threads.title: iMac 21.5" Mid Late 2015 820-00430-A no clue
threads.message: U7300 pin 12 5v, pin 16 3.3v pin 17 0v

threads.title: iMac 21.5" Mid Late 2015 820-00430-A no clue
threads.message:
Then you cannot have 0.6V at DDRVTT yet, as pin 17 is not enabled.
But you must have 1.2V at L7310; confirm that.

DDRVTT is enabled by CPU.

threads.title: iMac 21.5" Mid Late 2015 820-00430-A no clue
threads.message: Confirmed, I do have 1.193v at [LEFT][COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]L7310[/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]

threads.title: iMac 21.5" Mid Late 2015 820-00430-A no clue
threads.message:
Do you get 1V05_S0 and 1V5_S0?
Also check all voltages from page 63.

threads.title: iMac 21.5" Mid Late 2015 820-00430-A no clue
threads.message:
PP1V05_S0 is 0.005 and PP1V5_S0 is 0v

Power rails missing are PP1V2_S3_DDR, PP3V3_S0, PP1V5_S0 and PPCPUVCC_S0_CPU

threads.title: iMac 21.5" Mid Late 2015 820-00430-A no clue
threads.message:
Are you sure???
You just confirmed 1.2V at L7310 before...

threads.title: iMac 21.5" Mid Late 2015 820-00430-A no clue
threads.message: yes sorry [LEFT][COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]PP1V2_S3 and PP1V2_S3_DDR are present but not PP3V3_S0, PP1V5_S0 and PPCPUVCC_S0_CPU [/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]

threads.title: iMac 21.5" Mid Late 2015 820-00430-A no clue
threads.message: Post U8400/500 voltages.

threads.title: iMac 21.5" Mid Late 2015 820-00430-A no clue
threads.message:
Looks like missing PM_SLP_S3_L; check that.
Also check REG_P1V2_S3_PGOOD at U7300.
Be sure =PP3V3_S4_PWRCTL and R7340 OK.

threads.title: iMac 21.5" Mid Late 2015 820-00430-A no clue
threads.message:
[LEFT][COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]PM_SLP_S3_L present 3.3v [/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]
PM_PGOOD_REG_P1V2_S3 3.3v at U7300 R7340 is 19.49k checking real value now as I dont see that resistor on the schematic

threads.title: iMac 21.5" Mid Late 2015 820-00430-A no clue
threads.message: Whats strange is that [LEFT][COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]R7340 is ok at 19.49k but [/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT][COLOR=#007000]PM_PGOOD_REG_P1V2_S3 is 3.3v not 1.2v[/COLOR]

threads.title: iMac 21.5" Mid Late 2015 820-00430-A no clue
threads.message:
Mmmm, I just saw that in fact you didn't post any voltage for pins 8/9/10 of U8500.
I was reading values from U8400 instead.

Do you get PM_EN_S0?

threads.title: iMac 21.5" Mid Late 2015 820-00430-A no clue
threads.message: [LEFT][COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]PM_EN_S0 is 3.3v at U8500 [/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT]

threads.title: iMac 21.5" Mid Late 2015 820-00430-A no clue
threads.message: [LEFT][COLOR=#111111][FONT=inherit]PM_EN_S0 is 3.3v at U8600 but [/FONT][/COLOR][/LEFT][COLOR=#007000]PM_EN_FET_P3V3_S0_R at U8600 is 0.013v[/COLOR]

threads.title: iMac 21.5" Mid Late 2015 820-00430-A no clue
threads.message:
Yeas, because missing PM_PGOOD_REG_P1V05_S0 signal; which is same as REG_P1V05S0_PGOOD.
PM_EN_S0 presence suppose to get some S0 voltages controlled by this signal.
Check PM_EN_FET_P3V3_S0, PM_EN_FET_P12V_S0 and PM_EN_FET_P5V_S0
